Who's This Guy?

Let me tell you about myself.

Hello there, I'm Arhen (eyrhen) I'm an extremely introverted guy. They say I'm very intelligent, but not really, I just easily gets fascinated on certain things that interests me. I wasn't able to go to school normally, because of my physical condition I've been born with some sort of problem with my legs. I can feel them, and use them, I just can't stand properly. Despite that I keep on striving to reach wherever it is I want to go, and achieve whatever it is that I want.

How I Got Here

My Web Development Journey

I first learned about Web Development on January of 2017 when my mother told me that there is this online program that teaches various skills for undergrads, and there's this one course that would suite me well given my physical condition, and my computer savviness. At this point I have no idea how to code, I remember first time looking at a simple input element, and being confused as to what is the meaning of what.

The course itself was written, it was very basic it just basically introduces you to HTML5 and CSS3, and how they work. Now even though that course taught me so little it definitly gave me something I could call a skill that could get me somewhere, so I continued to scour the internet for more resources to learn from. It took me a year, and a half to have a great understanding of programming logic, and even then I still have a lot to learn.

When I got enough confidence in my skills I tried applying for jobs on various websites only to either be ignored, or not qualify. At this point I'm feeling really stuck, but I kept at it. After another year of just endless studying, and finding ways to earn a job my folks started telling me to try getting into other stuff, because web development maybe just isn't for me. I kept turning them down, because I felt like the time, and effort I've put into learning all about web development would just be wasted. At some point, because of getting so stressed, and feeling stuck I decided give learning, and finding a job a rest for a few months. I still tried to find a way to get other types of jobs like content writing, I even tried doing Youtube, but, because I don't have the right setup it's pretty hard.

After a while of trying to do other stuff, I decided to try to pursue this passion of mine again, but try even harder than before. I might get tired again, but I'm just gonna bounce back and learn from what I've been doing wrong.
